intro: Erigeron cuspidatus, commonly known as the sharpleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. It features narrow, sharply pointed leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron cuspidatus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
